newsitem.title: NORWAY: LITHUANIA-BALTIC BEVERAGE SAYS NOT BID FOR UTENOS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-BALTIC BEVERAGE SAYS NOT BID FOR UTENOS.

text.p: Finnish-Norwegian joint venture Baltic Beverages Holding (BBH) said on Wednesday it was in discussions on possibly buying parts of Lithuanian brewer Utenos Beverages.
But the company denied a report by Lithuanian newspaper Verslo Zinios that a bid had been made.
"There are discussions, but we have not made a bid," said Goeran Orre, spokesman for Pripps Ringnes.
BBH is owned jointly by Finland's Hartwall and Pripps Ringnes, part of Norway's Orkla .
Orre said it was not even certain that BBH would bid for Utenos.
"We have been operating in these markets for many years and learned that discussions can go on for a long time. We don't know for sure today if we are going to make a bid," Orre told Reuters.
The newspaper quoted the president of BBH, Henrik Therman, as saying his company would like to buy 50 percent or less in Utenos Beverages and thereby invest $20 million in the company.
"300 litas for a share (with face value of 100 litas) is a respectable price," Therman was quoted as saying.
